intro: Lapeirousia dolomitica subsp. lewisiana, commonly known as the Lewis's rain lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its bulbs are perennial and store water, allowing it to survive dry periods. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller size and pale pink to white flowers compared to the main species.
